Summary I am a convivial and very ambitious administrative assistant. Though I am currently working at Google, I have six years of experience working as a personal assistant and administrative assistant in different industries. I received my B.A. in Psychology with Honors from UC Berkeley. While at UC Berkeley, I worked as a research assistant, and completed an Honors thesis. I also gained leadership experience as a Peer Advisor in the Psychology Department and as a volunteer for UC Berkeley Dance Marathon, a benefit for Pediatric AIDS. Some of my skills include proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, Quickbooks, SPSS, French, and basic Italian. Personally, I'm very passionate about education, animal welfare, and I love music! 
 
Specialties: Organization, administrative tasks, multitasking, event planning, improving workplace efficiency. Summary I am a convivial and very ambitious administrative assistant. View Administrative Assistant Tilden Preparatory School September 2008  –  November 2011  (3 years 3 months) - Answered phones and greeted parents, students, and teachers at the front desk with professionalism. 
 
- Planned and facilitated the graduation ceremony each year, which involved: reserving the venue, ordering caps and gowns, printing diplomas, preparing and mailing invitations to parents, decorating the venue, coordinating volunteers at ceremony, acting as emcee at the event, greeting and welcoming families, creating a seating arrangement for students, and ordering catered food, based on dietary needs of guests. 
 
- Assisted school directors in transition from paper to entirely online progress reporting system. 
 
- Created and maintained textbook inventory and student paperwork filing system, resulting in greater office efficiency. 
 
- Created, maintained, and processed student enrollment forms and transcripts. 
 
- Scheduled students’ classes and use of group classrooms. 
 
- Created, revised, organized and submitted curriculum to UC and College Board, according to their policies and procedures, which was approved to be taught to the students. 
 
- Compiled and analyzed school surveys and other data for internal improvement. 
 
- Expanded, revised, and edited WASC Accreditation report, according to their policies and procedures, which helped lead to school’s independent accreditation. Summary Im passionate about user experience, delightful and beautiful design, and simple organization. Im passionate about user experience, delightful and beautiful design, and simple organization. Experience UXA Design Producer Google October 2014  – Present (10 months) San Francisco Bay Area The Unified Experience Alliance (UXA) team works closely with all product areas across Google to create the next-gen product design spec. This includes a section of standards and specifications unique to Google’s own suite of apps and may be used as a resource for any design team in the company. We are currently working on implementing Material Design, Google's bold new UI, inspired by the study of paper and ink, and grounded in tactile physical reality.  
 
As a Design Producer (ie. Program Manager), I work cross-org/cross-product, and collaborate with managers, designers and engineering teams to define milestones, secure and assign resources, assess risks, and help meet deadlines. I also manage project-related communications to team members, leaders and other stakeholders.  
 
My current focus is Imagery, which consists of developing build guidelines, a request system, a gallery and repository for photography and illustrations. I'm quickly learning how to be an expert juggler, a master planner and a flexible project manager who can balance multiple projects that always span continents, product areas, and disciplines. Chrome & APM Program, Administrative Business Partner Google January 2014  –  October 2014  (10 months) San Francisco Bay Area • Assist VP Linus Upson (Eng) 
• Assist 3 Directors: Glen Murphy (UX Design), Greg Simon (Eng), Ian Ellison-Taylor (Product) 
• Coordinate Associate Product Manager (APM) Program 
• Manage Chrome SF Office Events and Facilities

• Prioritize and proactively resolve conflicts for VP, Directors, 4 team calendars, affecting 2000+ ppl 
• Respond promptly to ~50 email threads/day for high level meetings, policy inquiries, deadlines 
• POC for travel logistics: visas, itineraries, price negotiations Ex: Exec travel, VIP Google I/O guest 
• Maintain internal events budget (worth $1.1milllion)  
• Co-Chair of Chrome/Apps Holiday Party 2013 for 1800 guests: Led 11 admins in monthly sync, created agenda and planning worksheet, delegated tasks, coordinated tasting, theme, etc 
• Manage all areas of event logistics, delegate day of tasks, negotiate pricing, communicate policies  
• Coordinate with facilities, VC-Ops, and external guests on scheduling and content ideas for APM Speaker Series 
• Maintain APM Program logistics: general questions, event planning, budget, timeline of events and rotations, offsite planning and ideas, alias groups, started go/apm site, etc 
• Project managed APM Trip for 37 Googlers, traveling on a 16 day business trip to 4 Google offices, meeting local tech companies, startups, incubators, cultural sites, etc. Managed health insurance, flights, budget, onsite travel logistics, doctor's visits, onsite contacts, etc Chrome & APM Program, Administrative Assistant II Google May 2011  –  December 2013  (2 years 8 months) San Francisco Bay Area • Assist 2 VPs: Linus Upson (Eng) & Brian Rakowski (Product), as well as 3-6 Directors 
• Coordinate Associate Product Manager (APM) Program (starting 7/2012)

Summary I am a program and community manager at Google currently overseeing the Google Summer of Code (GSoC) program. GSoC is an online, international philanthropic university outreach program that engages thousands of people every year. It encourages university students to get involved in open source software development while giving the organizations new developers every year that keep their communities thriving, vibrant, and diverse. I frequently speak publicly about GSoC and program management and have been routinely asked to keynote at large-scale technology conferences.  
 
I have experience overseeing software and network infrastructure projects internally, within the United States, and internationally. I am most passionate about growing communities and bringing technology to people all over the world. I'm also an budding horseback rider, amateur cook, armchair movie critic, cyclist, and bibliophile. 
 
Specialties: program management, community management, open source software, university outreach, public speaking, event management and coordination, logistics, purchasing. Experience Open Source Programs Manager, Google Summer of Code Google February 2010  – Present (5 years 6 months) San Francisco, California *Managed Google Summer of Code (GSoC) program and events for students and mentoring organizations from February, 2009 to present, including all 2014 10th anniversary events.  
*Envisioned 10th-anniversary program, including Director/VP approval for additional $1 million budget, implementation of a new payment processor, new conference and hotel facilities, additional program travel locations, and new program website and documentation. 
*Oversaw multi-million dollar yearly budget for GSoC, set all timelines, milestones, and budget from conception to execution for 4 years. 
*Handled community management and maintained a diverse, vibrant, and welcoming environment for GSoC through mailing list moderation, outreach at conferences and meetups. Keynoted at OSCON, LCA, and Joomla! World Conference. 
*Generated frequent postings on Official Google Blog, Open Source Blog, Developers Blog, Google Students Blog and ran multiple GSoC social media campaigns. 
*Gave 6 keynote addresses, 2 panel discussions, and 13 speaking engagements for ongoing promotion and outreach for GSoC. 
*Pitched and gained approval to expand the scope of the yearly GSoC Mentor Summit for the 5th year to solidify Google’s support for their participation and continue a high level of engagement among hundreds of prominent Open Source mentoring organizations. 
*Re-envisioned and executed international sister program to GSoC, Google Code-in. Re-branded, built budget and new timeline, promoted the program to high school students, and handled program administration during the contest. Summary A versatile and results-driven professional with a variety of experience in the fields of digital marketing, branded content development, experiential marketing, social media strategy and management, retail marketing execution, on-site event management, public relations, and talent acquisition. I have worked on major marketing and PR campaigns for some of the world’s most well known brands across multiple verticals from luxury and lifestyle to high tech. 
 
I started my career at Edelman Public Relations’ Sports and Entertainment Digital Marketing division, MATTER, Inc. in Los Angeles, CA. After nearly 3 years of working with an amazing team developing major marketing campaigns for such global consumer brands as Clorox, Pepsi, BlackBerry, Symantec, and the NFL, I returned to my native San Francisco to accept a position on the Google staffing team to embrace my passion for entrepreneurship and technology. 
 
Despite working in the tech-centric heart of Silicon Valley, my other interests include sports, food and fine dining, wine, travel, and fitness.
